numlitem.para: Rudder control surface position indicating system is operative, and
Rudder trim is verified to be centered before each departure.

placard.para: Placard Rudder Trim Indication System "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Before each departure, ensure rudder trim actuator is operative.

numlitem.para: Establish electrical power (AMM 24-22-00/201) and hydraulic power (AMM 29-11-00/201).

warning.para: ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Select STATUS on the EICAS display select panel to display the flight controls position indications.
Rotate the rudder trim control to NOSE LEFT.
On both Captain's and First Officer's sides, observe that left rudder pedals move forward and right rudder pedals move aft.
Also observe that rudder position indication on EICAS indicates rudder moving to left.
Rotate the rudder trim control to NOSE RIGHT.
On both Captain's and First Officer's sides, observe that left rudder pedals move aft and that right rudder pedals move forward.
Also observe that rudder position indication on EICAS indicates rudder moving to right.
Before each departure, verify rudder trim is centered:
Return rudder trim to neutral position by rotating the rudder trim control as required until rudder pedals are aligned and rudder position indication on EICAS shows rudder is centered.
